Beach / restaurant / bar / facilities maintained / maintained by a very friendly couple Sergio and his wife (Sergio speaks French!). Cheap meals on request. No water, shower and toilet available (ask Sergio). The place is in a natural park, so guards ensure that the place remains a parking and not more.

title: (5320) Nuzedo -
description: Super nice place to watch the setting sun, I stayed there one night and day without any problems

name: Cepo Verde
title: (5300-561) Cepo Verde
description: In the heart of Montesinho Natural Park, and 10 minutes away from the city of Bragança, the camping site is located in a mountain highland, filled with chestnut trees, oak trees and cherry trees and in a place recognised as an ancient Roman settlement. The campsite has individual spaces, with abundant shadows, and it provides a bar and restaurant open all year, with delicious traditional meals, homemade soup and pizzas done every day. In permanent exhibition at the bar/restaurant the world´s largest pocketknife with more than 2 meters high, registered int the Guiness World Records Book (original certificate exposed). The campers have full access to barbecue facilities outside. The park also has a traditional wood-fired oven in which bread is baked once a week. It is possible to pick cherries in June and July, and mushrooms in May and June, inside and outside the park. Offering a fantastic landscape and night scenery, the park is also a few minutes away from various signalled trails. Operating since 1993, this is a very quiet and family-friendly park.

title: (5320) Maçãs - Bairro de Cimo
description: Good place at the bus stop between street and fence to start from here a hike (yellow and red bars in Dine). Not suitable for overnight stays.

title: (5335) - N103
description: Road N103, 61km West Bragenza, nice, flat, top hill, short unpaved road, place with 360° free view, very quiet.

description: On Chaves road, turn right, 150m, fairly flat and wide, ideal for picnic or night ...

title: (5300) - N206

title: () Moimenta - Lgo do Toural

title: (5385) - 14 Largo Aguieira

Beautiful view, tranquility, an old castell (or village) on the hill. There is a public toilet (round door) at the cemetery parking lot around the corner.

title: (5300) Bragança - Unnamed Road

The absence of trees can be prohibitive in the summer season.

The road from the Zamorano side is sloping, winding and narrow, with a lot of potholes, and some trucks from the AVE works circulate along it. Access from the Galician side does not offer difficulties.

title: (5300) Restaurante O Rústico
description: Caravela! Restaurant and parking the Rustico. Private parking with water and table and possibility of toilet in the restaurant. Restaurant and village center (60 people) held by Adelaide and Amendio and their son Alex who speak French very well. Nice restaurant to eat a good rib of beef. Warm and friendly welcome. Very quiet and relaxing place.

title_short: (5340-310) Macedo de Cavaleiros - 6 Rua das Piscinas

title: (5400-745) Santo António de Monforte -
description: Place to stop motorhomes near the nogueirinha reservoir easy access from here on foot to the water. Very quiet night and beautiful view over the city of Chaves.

title: (5430) - R206

title: (49392) Pedralba de la Pradería - camino bajo de repilao
title_short: (49392) Pedralba de la Pradería - camino bajo de repilao
description: 10 km south of the town of Pedralba de la Pradería, towards Santa Cruz de Abranes, in the Sanabria region and framed by the Culebra and Atalaya mountain ranges, is this night area belonging to the Raia Route of North (first European cross-border motorhome route). The area has 8 parking spaces, a gray water disposal area and a black water discharge point, in addition, drinking water can be recharged for an additional fee. It also has a video surveillance camera and a Wi-Fi point. In addition to Pedralba de la Pradería, the towns of Calabor, Lobeznos, Rihonor de Castilla and Santa Cruz de Abranes are part of this municipality. In every city there is something to see, such as, for example, the medicinal waters of the Calabor or Riho mnnor thermal baths in Castile, crossed by the border with Portugal, coexisting with its Portuguese neighbors of Río de Onor. exact address: camino bajo de repilao (carretera de Portugal).

title: (5300) Rio Frio - Avenida da Fontainha
description: Rio Frio, free parking for motorhomes very quiet and spacious. With playground, barbecue area, tables and chairs made of stone.

title: (32611) Riós - N-525
description: Ideal place for a meal, very quiet, ideal for a break during a long journey

title: (5430) Valpaços - Unnamed Road
description: For lunch break or more, no prohibition sign, beautiful view, too bad, not very clean

title: (5300) - 6 EM1059

The route descends to the town of Cabreiroá at the height of Verín. Parking slightly inclined. Pretty village, with a stone cross at the bottom of the town. Source 200 meters down town. Attention, leave the Rías Baixas highway at exit 155, otherwise when you reach the village of Osoño you will have to turn around.

description: Large parking located next to a church (the bell does not ring the day). This parking will only allow you to park, but to spend the night quietly.

title: () Izeda - 13-14 Largo do Toural
description: The pitch is straight and there is enough space for several campers. There is a waste water disposal station and a possibility to fill up with fresh water. The place is in the town center and if you walk down the street in the direction of “Marktplatz”, there is a permanently installed dixi toilet 200m away. I stayed for one night and it was very quiet and pleasant, I highly recommend.

title: (5300) Quintanilha -
description:
Great barbecue and picnic area around a hermitage. The highway sounds in the background but it doesn't bother. Tables in the shade of hundred-year-old trees. Trash. Fountain. WC.
Today he is clean and at peace. There is not a single toilet paper on the floor. Please, make it clean again. If you urinate or excrete, put the paper and excrement in a bag and throw it in the garbage container

title: (5400) Chaves - N103-5
description: Parking at the Ecovia Tamega in Outeiro Seco, quiet at the water's edge

title: (32600) Verín - 2 Lugar Cabreiroa
description: Perfect to stop and drink free water from Cabreiroa water. There are tables and a lot of shadow.

title: (5300) Bragança - Rua Santo António
description: On the edge of a small road table and bench for a picnic take a break in the shade

title: (32615) Verín - 278 Lugar Abedes
description: Park next to the river, very quiet, good place to eat and park the van next to it.

title: (5400) Quinta de Montalvões - EM506
description: Small side street from the main street. Located near the motorway. Quiet night spent except for passing cars. Great for a quick and short night.

title: (32619) Vilamaior -
description: Small quiet corner near a church in the middle of the vineyards

title: (49393) Ungilde -
description: Alto de Folgueira. It is a strategic point from which to observe local fauna and the bellowing season. There is a wide and flat track on both sides of the road.

title: (5430) - Unnamed Road
description: Visited site May 2022. A slightly odd and eerie place. Satnav took us up a very steep unmade road. At the top we found a disused and vandalised toilet block, some very old children’s play equipment and a view. No water. We didn’t stay. We left by a made up road, poor condition, past the old church which, if we had found first, we might have stayed but earlier experience put us off.

title: (5370) Rio Torto - N213
description: Nice surprise this morning when this place was revealed to us on waking. We fell there by chance in the middle of the night at the end of a path without seeing where we really were ... Riverside, calm with a disused mill. Very nice site.

title: (32554) Viana do Bolo - OU-533
description: Nice place at the river, close to the main road but quiet at night. No service but few stone tablet and trash bin. 200 m to a restaurant (often closed)

title: (32600) Verín - 37 Rúa Juan Guerra Valdés
description: More or less central parking, surrounded by buildings. Perfect for overnight

title: (49517) San Martín del Pedroso - 8 Calle Iglesia San Martín Pedro
title_short: (49517) San Martín del Pedroso - 8 Calle Iglesia San Martín Pedro
description: Perfect place for landscaped van. Next to a river, pastures and forest. Go down a small hill at the end of the village and you will arrive near the river Ps: Watch out for the dog. A MASTIN

title: (32600) Verín - 5 Rúa Travesía
description: Quiet sandy parking lot. Both own and along a path in the separations. There were some van and small motorhome. The big ones are more complicated

title: (49517) San Martín del Pedroso -
description:
Place in the middle of nature. on a relatively flat and immense terrain. a few meters from the previous spot. the place is quiet and clean. we had the visit of the inhabitants of the village in evening walk (~ 20h). You will find garbage cans in the village as well as a park for children and water.

Thank you for respecting the places as well as the inhabitants.

title: (5370) Mirandela -
description: Large unserviced car park next to the campsite, beautiful view among the olive trees. Bicycle path and hiking trail. Ideal for spending a quiet night.

title: (32613) Oímbra - Carretera de Oimbra
description: Picnic area at the edge of a shady stream. Barbecues available, small tirolienne and fitness trail.

title: (32600) Verín - 10 Rúa Elvira Carrera
description: On the 3rd, 11th and 23rd of each month there is a fair (flea market) in the center of the town. Those days it is more complicated to park in the morning... also on those days there are pulpeiras selling octopus rations on the street

name: 3 Rios Maravilha
title: () 3 Rios Maravilha
description: Campsite with camper van reception. Giant swimming pool in the campsite (provide supplement for the swimming pool) very pleasant during the hot summer months. On the other hand, isolated from the city.

title: (5230-063) Bragança - 8 N218
description: Parking where we spent the night quiet and safe near a small children's playground

title: (32600) Verín - 24I Avenida Luis Espada
description: Ample central parking, quiet place to visit Verin and its surroundings, you can visit its springs and highly recommended the casa do pulpo.

title: (32600) Verín - 17 Avenida Luis Espada
description: Self service launderette

title: (32600) Verín - 36 Rúa do Olivar
description: Very quiet area on the banks of the river and near the center, has tables and green area

title: (32600) Verín - 1A Camiño da Preguiza
description: Parking on the outskirts, next to the path that runs along the river. Very nice and quiet place.

title: (49362) Ribadelago Nuevo - 6 Calle Tajo
description: Sanabria lake next door, fine if you're staying the night here, the site is flat and there are shaded areas

title: (49521) Riomanzanas - ZA-L-2454
description: Near the village

title: (49583) Porto - 4 Calle Pinguela
description:
Nice and quiet place on the banks of the River with natural pool without services at the entrance of the town, free, good place for hiking.
It belongs to the Raia Norte Route (the first European cross-border motorhome route) and has 8 parking spaces, a grey water emptying area and a black water exchange terminal.

title: (49583) Porto - 10 Calle Margareu
description: Large plot of grass surrounded by nature, children's playground, soccer field, very clean public toilets, a spout with delicious water and a beautiful natural pool. At 11 or so the baker passes by with a van. Beautiful town and great reception of its inhabitants, super friendly and hospitable people. If you are close, do not miss this stop, fall in love !!!!

title: () Porto - Unnamed Road
description: It is a spectacular viewpoint where you and the cows are, peace and quiet, with unbeatable 360 ° views with several routes nearby. Gazebo well clapboards.

title: (5400) Chaves - Avenida Doutor Mário Soares
description: Stayed on a Friday night. The car park was a combination of drag racing and rally car racing until 2am.    Possibly ok during the week.  We moved the following day!  The location is great with a short and pretty walk along the river to the old town.

title: (5400-505) Chaves - Alameda de la Galinheira.
description: Free parking near the old town right on the river. There is a park right there for walking the dog.

title: (49362) Galende - 1 Camino Galende
description: Day parking only on the roadside. Perfect to spend the day and take a walk in the surroundings. River beach approx 300 m. Overnight prohibited.

title: (5400-017) Chaves - 10 Avenida 5 de Outubro
description:
Large car park, which allows you to visit the center and the Roman bridge by walking about 300m along the water.
Nothing prevents you from sleeping but very attractive

title: (5400) Chaves - 39 Avenida Trindade
description:
LIDL parking area for motorhome.
3 places

title: (49362) Ribadelago - 13 Barrio Alto Ribadelago
description: Parking to visit the Tera River Canyon. We spent the night very quiet, next to the river and the source of drinking water. Kiosk with cold drink very close.

title: (49362) Ribadelago - 13 Barrio Alto Ribadelago
description: Ribadelago, an esplanade of land, the only place where you can park to visit the town, although the access is by a narrow path.

title: (32619) Monterrei - Rúa do Castelo
description: At the foot of Monterrei Castle near the town of Ciro. Beautiful setting, visit of the castle, hotel, restaurant and cafeteria. To discover. On grassy parking. Walking access to the castle because narrow streets.

title: (32619) Monterrei - 22 Lugar Monterrei
description: Area for parking and overnight stay bem embaixo do castelo. Quite amplo and calm. Suggested area for the castelo tourist information team. Very loving and informative. Obrigado

title: () Chaves - Alameda Galinheira
description: Chaves car park, authorized from 8 a.m. to 10 p.m. to visit the city.

title: (5400-355) Chaves - 26 Rua Longras
description: A large and very quiet car park. Very level. Near the town centre. The other parking places indicated here are no longer available. I had no problem here.

title: (49300) Puebla de Sanabria - 178 Calle Negrillo
description: Parking near the big town to park motorhomes. Quiet but on slope. Ideal to visit the town. To sleep better on the other side of the river.

name: Camping Isla de Puebla
title: (49300) Camping Isla de Puebla
description: Municipal campsite, very cheap and very pleasant. The place is simple but it has every bar / restaurant, swimming pool, park ... it is a bit old but for the price paid it has seemed very adequate.

title: (5400-524) Chaves - 22 Alameda Trajano
description: Public parking next to the Tâmega river in a dead end street. Apparently calm. Unbeatable views. Near bar restaurant in the same parking

title: (49396) Zamora - 26 Poblado Castro
description: It has picnic areas and barbecues. Near the highway.

title: (5400) Chaves - Largo Nossa Senhora da Lapa
title_short: (5400) Chaves - Largo Nossa Senhora da Lapa
description: Park not in the city center. Optimal performance of all.

title: (49362) Galende - ZA-104
description: Parking only during the day as it is forbidden to stay overnight. There is a beach 2 minutes walking and a snack bar in the same parking lot. Place of departure of the Sanabria Environmental Cruise. This activity is very good and ideal for children. Parking is usually filled after 12.00.

title: (32619) Monterrei - Estrada de Vences
description: Small quiet place by the river. A dam allows to bathe there. There is room to park (several vans). A perfect stop!

title: (5400-541) Chaves - 15 Alameda Trajano
description: Nice parking lot on the edge of the calm water come at the end of the evening to have space.

title: (5400-524) Chaves - 7 Rua Tabolado
description: Laundromat - be careful on Sundays-

title: (49395) Cobreros -
description: BP gas station, in which for 2 euros they give the option to shower. In principle it is for truckers, so it is in the men's bathroom, but we can enter women without problem. Clean and hot water with pressure, very correct everything. They are only open during the day. At night they are not available

title: (5400-323) Chaves - 6 Rua Caneiro
description:
Outside self service laundry in E Leclerc carpark. Cash ONLY.
Washing machine.
Dryer.

title: (5400-517) Chaves - 5 Alameda Tabolado
description: Free parking on the street. Next to nice park and restaurants.

title: (5370-285) Mirandela -
description: Parque Verde da city with many activities and a lot of space next to the Padaria river, gasoline pumps and public toilets (dated at night), soccer field, tênis and river praia

title: (5370-408) Mirandela - N15
description: Free parking for city tours and ancient bridge.

title: (5400-180) Chaves - 25 Rua do Sal
description: Public toilets, right on the side of the city hall.

title: (49300) Puebla de Sanabria - 26 Camino Pinar
description: Paid area for motorhomes. Already operational but surely awaiting official inauguration or other because it is not indicated to access it.

title: (49393) Robledo - Unnamed Road
description: Parking of the Felix Rodríguez de la Fuente Iberian Wolf Center. Spacious, with several flat areas, without services but very quiet to spend the night if you are going to visit the center in the morning.

title: (5400-563) Chaves -
description: Day parking near the wall and the thermal area.

title: (49362) Galende - ZA-104
description: Ample parking near a large lake, surrounded by nature, there is a beach and a snack bar, only possible during the day.

title: (5400-518) Chaves - GUEST HOUSE CHAVES, 46 Rua Solidão
title_short: (5400-518) Chaves - GUEST HOUSE CHAVES, 46 Rua Solidão
description: This space is located in the center of the large garden town of Chaves and in your environment has many sporting activities, a hiking and biking track. The Tâmega River is 20 meters and the center of the city is 200 meters.

title: (5400-569) Chaves -
description:
Laundry service.
Open all year from 8:00 to 22:00.
Self service. Easy parking in the area while doing the laundry.
Across the street from the Hospital.

title: (5400) Chaves - Rua do Lazer
description: Small parking lot not far from the water and easy to access. A family spent the night there. we just day parking because the others were busy because of the Gallo Roman festival

title: (5300) Deilão - Unnamed Road
description: Altar and covered picnic areas, on the banks of the river. Ample parking. In the Portuguese area, there are covered picnic areas, with bathrooms (open in the summer season) and in the Spanish area, on the other side of the river, open picnic areas, barbecues and also with ample parking space. Quiet place, close to the town.

title: (49300) Puebla de Sanabria - 19B Carretera Lago
description: 10 minutes from downtown and easily accessible in front of the parador.

title: (5370-201) Mirandela - 231 Alameda Rio Tua
description: Parking next to the Tua river. Quiet place with shade of trees.

name: Camping Los Robles
title: (49361) Camping Los Robles
description: Small but very neat campsite, quiet. 10 minutes walk from one of the beaches of Lake Sanabria. Very welcoming. Good restaurant to eat. Very clean bathrooms. I do not know if they have for emptying black water, gray yes.

title: (49361) Ribadelago - 1 Diseminado Ribadelago Fran
description: Varias plazas en los alrededores del antiguo balneario de bouzas (abandonado) con vistas al lago de sanabria. Acceso por camino con cierta pendiente y bastante roto sólo apto para 4x4. Varias zonas niveladas o fáciles de nivelar. Acceso a un pequeño punto donde bañarse en el lago. Recomendable acceso y estancia con discreción ya que está muy cerca del camping los robles.

title: (32557) Vilariño de Conso - 942 Estrada de Soutelo
title_short: (32557) Vilariño de Conso - 942 Estrada de Soutelo
description: Free natural water pool. Ideal to cool off in summer. In the town of Villarino de Conso there is a supermarket and a bar.

title: (49393) Puebla de Sanabria - Unnamed Road
description: A place in the middle of nature on the edge of a "road" but in such poor condition that it looks like a forest track, tables, barbecue and a fountain, very close to the center of the Iberian wolf of Castilla y León, your visit is recommended and also close to Puebla de Sanabria, we spent a very quiet night

title: (5445) -
description: Parking lot of '' Altar de sacrifícios, '' in Argeriz. large lot on flat grass or almost with large trees and picnic tables and bins and another open area ... all with a beautiful view of the valley

title: (32550) Viana do Bolo - 39 Rúa Libertade
description: The place is ideal to spend the night in winter. It is a very quiet public parking lot. It is covered so it is perfect in case it snows, rains or frosts. Just above is the bus station.

title: (49350) El Puente - 7 Carretera Barrio
description: Cheap gas station in a52 direction Benavente Antonio del Estal López service station next to La Puebla de Sanabria. The bridge, towards the lake you have to go out very little, about 8kms

title: (49360) Galende - ZA-104
description: Nice place by the river, for a day .. :) Stony path but easy to access for small camper. Nice decor between mountain and river:) Night prohibited

title: (49360) Galende - 12 ZA-104
description: Free parking, in the middle of the forest by the river away and close to everything. 5 minutes from a large beach through the forest.

title: (49390) Puebla de Sanabria -
description: Some 2 km before El Puente there is a sign to the left Zona Recreativo. It is called Peña de Olla. Right next to the river with a small beach. We spend one night.

title: (49350) El Puente - 16 Calle Plaza
description: Parking in the city center

title: (49350) Galende - 6 ZA-104
description: Motorcycle field at the side of te road. used only once a year, we stayed the night. Old bbq spots too.

title: (49361) - 148 Diseminado Vigo Sanabria
description: This is a large car park to access the lake which is a weekend destination in the summer. The area is beautiful, crystal clear water with mountain drop-back. There is a bar / restaurant and peddle boats can be rented a bit further along. On the other side of the car park is a popular restaurant. You are not allowed to park here over night as it's within the natural park. If caught you could be facing a hefty fine.
